DataElement.preferredName: Book Randomization Allocation Plan Study Activity Repeat Duration ISO21090.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity that is intended to occur at some point in the course of a particular study and that is the assignment of an experimental unit to a portion of the study, such as an arm or a portion of an arm (when secondary allocations may occur) based on a randomization book. NOTE(S): A randomization book is a predefined set of assignments to portions of a study based on criteria, such as stratum group for example, that ensures a desired distribution of subjects across those portions of the study. For example, the book entries indicate which arm a given subject, Joe, is assigned to based on the fact that he's the 5th person in stratum group #2. The period of time over which the planned activity is repeated.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Book Randomization Allocation Plan Study Activity Repeat Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A volume made up of pages fastened along one edge and enclosed between protective covers. (from American Heritage Dictionary):The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:To devise, contrive, or formed in design.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Make or do or perform again.:The period of time during which something continues.

The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.
